choices.name: Get started with research for your Nevada ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Nevada ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Nevada research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Nevada research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Nevada Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Nevada ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Nevada Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Nevada research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Nevada Resources
    ☆ AC—Nevada State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Nevada Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Nevada Record Finder
    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Nevada in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Nevada

    2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Nevada in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Nevada


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Nevada in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Nevada

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Nevada in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Nevada

1. Explore Nevada historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Nevada History

  2. Explore Nevada history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Nevada

  3. Learn about Nevada history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Nevada History

choices.name: Learn about Nevada archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nevada archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nevada Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Nevada State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Explore links for archives and libraries on the Nevada Genealogy site.
  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Nevada.
  4. Explore the Nevada Dept. of Archives collection.
  5. Explore the Cooperative Libraries Automated Network collection.
  6. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Nevada genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  7. Search for ☆free online books on Nevada research on the FamilySearch site.
  8. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Nevada ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Nevada city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nevada Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Nevada city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Nevada city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Nevada ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Nevada city directories on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Nevada County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Nevada.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Nevada Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Nevada Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Nevada Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  4. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Nevada.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Nevada research.
  2. Explore the Nevada research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Nevada research.

choices.name: Learn about Nevada genealogy and historical societies.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Nevada in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Nevada Societies

  2. Explore the Nevada State Genealogical Society site.
  3. Explore the Nevada Historical Society site.
  4. Explore links for historical and genealogical societies on the Nevada Genealogy site.
  5. Explore Nevada genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  6. Get help at a family history center in Nevada.
